message:
SYSTEM: D31_-_SEEMP_Platform_specifications%28v1%29.pdf: Página 18
 
D31 –                        Version 1.1 
 
Project IST-4-027347-STP 
Page 18 of 21
 
The time ontology in Upper Cyc Ontology6, which is included in the Cyc knowledge base 
[Lenat et al 1990]. 
The Unrestricted Time ontology7, developed at the Italian National Research Council 
(CNR). 
The Simple Time ontology8, which has been considered for developing further time 
ontologies, like the Reusable Time and the Kestrel Institute Time. 
The Reusable Time [Zhou et al 2000], a very detailed ontology time developed at 
Stanford University.  
The Kestrel Institute Time9 ontology. 
The SRI Time ontology10 developed by the SRI’s Artificial Intelligence Center. 
The modelling of time in SUMO11, developed by the IEEE Standard Upper Ontology 
working group. 
The DAML time ontology12, implemented inside the DAML group. 
The AKT Time ontology13, developed inside the AKT initiative. 
We use the criteria presented in [Fernández-López et al 2004] and we choose the DAML 
ontology to  model the time in SEEMP platform. DAML ontology is implemented in OWL. 
Selecting Currency classification 
The following non-exhaustive list presents some examples of currency classifications: 
Pacific Exchange Rate Service14  
ISO 421715
WordAtlas16
We choose the ISO 4217 currency names and code elements. 
Selecting geographic location classification 
The following non-exhaustive list presents some examples of geographic location 
classifications: 
• 
ISO 316617 Maintenance agency (ISO 3166/MA) – ISO's focal point for country 
codes.
